Issues.Title: Replacing some ArgumentOutOfRangeException with custom messages with throw helpers
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #9726


## Proposed changes

This is a follow-up to #9728, only this time we are dealing with less standard `ArgumentOutOfRangeException`s, so the message will change a bit. Here, I made changes only to cases where I figured the messages added little value to the default ones:

- SR.InvalidArgument
- SR.InvalidLowBoundArgumentEx
- SR.InvalidLowBoundArgument
- SR.InvalidHighBoundArgumentEx
- SR.InvalidHighBoundArgument
- SR.InvalidBoundArgument
- SR.IndexOutOfRange

## Risk

- low, but higher than the pure fixer modifications. I still used the IDE as much as possible (e.g. to break if clauses into 2) so that CA1512 could apply. To do so, I manually modified the exception to remove the custom message after verfying that we do not lose any information by doing so.

## Test methodology

- CI

Issues.Title: Ensure Form Doesn't Prevent Shutdown
Issues.Body:
Fixes #9210 

In #7561 the result for `WM_QUERYENDSESSION` was accidentally flipped causing the return for `WM_QUERYENDSESSION` to be `false`, which would prevent shutdown/log off. This change fixes this and also adds a test that ensures that `Form` will return `true` for a `WM_QUERYENDSESSION` message.

Issues.Title: Fix IRawElementProviderSimple.GetPropertyValue (#9732)
Issues.Body:
Our interop handle structs (such as HWND) cannot be marshalled directly and will fail "silently" on callbacks (they will throw but the marshaller will convert that to an HRESULT that we won't see unless first-chance exceptions are on when we're debugging).

### This change should be merged, not squashed- it ports #9732

Issues.Title: System.Drawing.Common xml docs limited after .NET 6.0
Issues.Body:
@JeremyKuhne

Yes, the absence of a README is _certainly unfortunate_, but there is a much more significant issue - the lack of documentation (hints in Visual Studio) for most elements from `System.Drawing.Common`:

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/17767561/a7fd743a-0df9-4c32-a861-eed9738e2ff3)

I quickly checked the NuGet packages and found that starting from Net6, the XML file has been significantly slimmed down:
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/17767561/cf8b85cb-3f5b-46b2-bd0f-70ac62f0192f)

The line from the V.S. screenshot above (`"T:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath"`) is only present in version 4.70: 
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/17767561/03e0635f-4665-4292-bec4-e11a43beb552)

_Originally posted by @kirsan31 in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/9729#issuecomment-1681843321_

Issues.Title: Winforms designer moves anchored control
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.100-rc.1.23415.19

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, this issue cannot repro in .NET7.0 & .NET 6.0.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/f2cb9dc0-b311-4640-933c-a204eb936646



### Issue description

**Current Behavior:**
The button's been moved.
After step5:
![design](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/927cca43-91d8-45be-9dfc-19dedad86988)

After step6:
![moved design](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/fbcf067c-c90e-4468-8027-4519bde76d9c)


But in runtime, the button is not moved.
![moved run](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/b293678c-8ce6-46eb-9e09-dd23bfc44817)


https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/9858de36-6082-48d6-a586-1d62fc831b4e


 
**Expected Behavior:**
The button shouldn't be moved.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/02cb3533-bcd2-43aa-8846-e72e3345d59d



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .NET Core 8.0 application
2. Add a panel to form designer
3. Change the panel's Dock property to Bottom
4. Add a button to the panel
5. Change the button's anchor property from top & left to bottom & right
6. Close and reopen form designer
7. Observe the location of the button control

**More Info:**
1. This issue also reproes in other container controls and common controls.
2. The initial ticket link is here: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1866799
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms designer moves anchored control" (#9740)

Issues.Title: Merge feature/9.0 into main
Issues.Body:
**This should be merged as a merge-commit!**

```
git fetch
git checkout main
build
git checkout -b merge-feature-into-main
git commit -a -m "Add new localization strings that were generated by the build into the templates package"
git merge upstream/feature/9.0 
```

Source code conflicts were auto-merged. But PublicAPIs required manual merging:
```
Auto-merging src/System.Windows.Forms/src/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in src/System.Windows.Forms/src/PublicAPI.Shipped.txt
Auto-merging src/System.Windows.Forms/src/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in src/System.Windows.Forms/src/PublicAPI.Unshipped.txt
Auto-merging src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.cs
Auto-merging src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/ToolStripPanelRow.ToolStripPanelRowControlCollection.cs
Auto-merging src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/TreeNodeCollection.cs
```
I took published APIs from main and the new unpublished APIs from the feature branch. The unpublished APIs came from
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/9620

Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #7852


## Proposed changes

- Implemented HasKeyboardFocusPropertyId for TextBoxBaseAccessibleObject.
- Modify the trigger condition for Text_TextSelectionChangedEventId/Text_TextChangedEventId of TextBox and MaskedTextBox.
- Update the Text property in the TextBoxBaseUiaTextProvider to ensure that passwords are not displayed in plaintext in Insights.
<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- When enable UseSystemPasswordChar or PasswordChar properties in TextBox/MaskedTextBox, Narrator won't announce the text.
- Passwords are not displayed as plaintext in Insights.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Low

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

<!-- TODO -->
When typing text in TextBox/MaskedTextBox with UseSystemPasswordChar or PasswordChar, Narrator announce text to "Hidden", but when focus on TextBox/MaskedTextBox or specific text, it will announce as specific text.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/704b82a7-d6d2-4e65-b639-163177d5ba16)

### After

<!-- TODO -->
When enable UseSystemPasswordChar or PasswordChar properties in TextBox/MaskedTextBox, Narrator won't announce the text, and passwords are not displayed as plaintext in Insights.
![TextBox](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/133954995/44e45bd5-ec76-4c20-a683-e94bedbf760b)

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual
